dataClass
Class SelectedCourse

java.lang.Object
  dataClass.Course
      dataClass.SelectedCourse
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<SelectedCourse>
public class SelectedCourse
extends Course
implements java.lang.Comparable<SelectedCourse>, java.io.Serializable

This class is a course selected by a student. On top of all the information in the Course class, this also contains the data on which semester this course is taken.

Author:
Niels Thykier, Frederik Nordahl Sabroe, Morten SÃ¸rensen
See Also:

SelectedCourse

public SelectedCourse(Course course,
                      int semester)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      CourseCannotStartInThisSemesterException
Create a SelectedCourse from a Course and a semester.

Parameters:
course - An object of the Course type.
semester - the semester it is taken on.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if semester is invalid (e.g. less than 1).
CourseCannotStartInThisSemesterException - Thrown if the course cannot start in that semester.
Method Detail

compareTo

public int compareTo(SelectedCourse compareTo)
Follows the standards of the compareTo method. This class is sorted first by the semester it appears in and secondarily the number of the course if the semesters are the same.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<SelectedCourse>
Parameters:
compareTo - the object to compare to this one.
Returns:
a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.
See Also:
Comparable.compareTo(java.lang.Object)

getStartingSemester

public int getStartingSemester()
Get the semester in which this course starts.

Returns:
The semester

getStartingPeriod

public int getStartingPeriod()
Returns the starting period for this course.

Returns:
The period this course starts in.

getFinishingPeriod

public int getFinishingPeriod()
Returns the period in which this course finishes. (For 1 period courses, this will be the same period as the starting period, for 2 period courses it will be starting period + 1 and so on...)

Returns:
The period this course end in.

getIsInSameSemester

public int getIsInSameSemester(SelectedCourse compareTo)
Check if this course and the compareTo course are share at least one period. Used as a part of the test for determining conflicts between courses. This, however, cannot tell if they have courses on the same days!

Parameters:
compareTo - The course to test against.
Returns:
-1,0 or 1 if this course is ends before, shares at least one period with or comes after the compareTo course.

getIsInPeriod

public int getIsInPeriod(int start,
                         int finish)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Check if the course is within a given period. Used as a part of the test for determining conflicts between courses. This, however, cannot tell if they have courses on the same days!

Parameters:
start - The first period of interest.
finish - The last period of interest.
Returns:
-1,0 or 1 if this course is ends before, shares at least one period with or comes after the period-range.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the "start" is greater than "finish", "start" is less than 1 or "finish" greater than 41

getHasSkemaInPeriod

public boolean getHasSkemaInPeriod(int period)
Test if this course has lectures in this single period.

Parameters:
period - the period to test.
Returns:
true if the course has something in that period.

isValidSemester

public static boolean isValidSemester(int semester)
Tests if the inputted semester is valid

Parameters:
semester - The value to test
Returns:
true of the semester is valid. (0 < semester < 21)
